lines.text: Care to have supper?
I'm busy.
After supper?
Bed.
Ok!... Emilia, it's joke!
You know, only this morning she came up to me and she said, "Sevilla, deary, you're the greatest prima ballerina in the whole world."
No, I am.
It didn't work out.
Oh, so what? He liked boys better than girls?
Oh, not exactly. He knew my priority was dancing.
Are you... sorry?
No. I don't believe in being sorry. We are what we are.
[looking back at old pictures of themselves]
Oh God, I looked like shit.
Next to Wayne, we all did...
[Yuri is rubbing a young ballerina's sore leg]
I have weak knees...
I like girls with weak knees.
You just like girls...
I know you're angry.
I'm not angry.
You damn well are. You're just covering it up with ice. That little Russian behaved like a bastard, so you're taking it out on me.
Oh, God... dancers have such ugly feet.
Oh, I had the hots for you back in those days. Only I never came up to you because you were always at the barre. And I didn't look so good in tights. And now the toe shoe is on the other foot.
Oh, really?
Yeah. Now we BOTH don't look so good in tights.
Speak for yourself.
I would love to give you a divorce.
I'm on the pill... just in case.
Daddy wouldn't do what you did.

Emma said some things. First, she said I married you and had a family with because I knew I wasn't good enough to go professional as a ballet dancer. That wasn't true. But... she also said I had a child with you to prove that you were straight. That was sort of true. I wanted
I know.
You... you do?
Yeah. I guess I wanted to prove it myself.
That jealousy - it's poison.
Dancers have such ugly feet. Ugh. If I was a man, I could have all the feet... I mean, CHILDREN I wanted to... and still danced.

[to DeeDee]
Oh, that's not a little toad. That's rather a large bullfrog!
Oh, Emma... if only she knew what we know now...
It wouldn't matter worth a damn...
Am I like you?
I don't know...
How not?
